body.p: WE RAISE BIG LEMONS The prize lemon brought from Flo- rida recently and presented to Mr. and Mrs. William Ball, has nothing on what Jackson county can produce. A. W. Helwig of Alma Center, has a 16-year-old lemon tree in the Jackson County Bank at Alma Center, which ! matured four lemons this month, two of which were 12 inches, in circum- ference and weighed onq pound and four ounces each, and the other two were a little over one half as large. Mrs. Helwig made two pics from one of the lemons, and one of the smaller ones is still on the tree. The tree at present is covered with blossoms, and i bids fair to outdo the 1939 crop the coming season. Several years ago Mr. Helwig had a lemon that measur- ed 13 x/i inches from this same tree. Mr. Helwig thinks people might be in- terested in knowing they do not have to go to Florida to see large lemons growing on a tree. All you have to do is come to Jackson county.
